verse: चिदानन्दाकारं श्रुति सरस सारं समरसं निराधाराधारं भवजलधिपारं पर गुणम् । रमा ग्रीवाहारं व्रजवनविहारं हर नुतं सदा तं गोविन्दं परमसुखकन्दं भजत रे ॥
meaning: Worship Govinda, the embodiment of consciousness and bliss, the essence of scriptural texts, harmonious and without support, the transcendental ocean of attributes. He is worshipped by Lakshmi, who resides in the neck, frolics in the forests of Vraja, and is always worshipped by Shiva, the remover of obstacles. Govinda is the bestower of supreme happiness.

terms.चिदानन्दाकारं: of the form of consciousness and bliss
terms.भवजलधिपारं: the ocean of samsara (cycle of birth and death)
terms.व्रजवनविहारं: frolicking in the forests of Vraja
terms.गोविन्दं: Govinda, a name of Lord Krishna
